abstract.para: The purpose of this FAQ is to provide quick answers to quick questions. Where ever appropriate, pointers to more "formal" documentation (guides, HOWTOs, reference pages) will be provided.

answer.para: &IC; pages are not kept in normal HTML space. Look in the catalog subdirectory pages. The pages are always filtered through the &IC; daemon before being delivered.

&IC; is a &glos-CGI; program, and if relative image paths were used, erroneous &glos-img; output like the following would have occured: For that reason, by default, &IC; uses &conf-ImageDir; or &conf-ImageDirSecure; for a prefix used to rewrite image URLs. In the demo, image specs that have no absolute path information are prefixed with /simple/images/.
